meanings.definition: A device used to indicate the degree of synchronization between two alternating currents.
meanings.sent1: The synchroscope on the control panel showed that the currents were perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent2: The electrician installed a synchroscope to monitor the synchronization of the alternating currents.
meanings.sent3: During the power outage, the synchroscope started blinking in a synchronized pattern, amusing the technicians.
meanings.sent4: The synchroscope acted like a conductor, ensuring the alternating currents stayed in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The synchroscope hummed softly, revealing the perfect synchronization of the currents.

meanings.definition: To synchronize or compare the phase of two alternating currents using a synchroscope.
meanings.sent1: The engineer needed to synchroscope the currents before connecting the new generator.
meanings.sent2: It is important to synchroscope the alternating currents to prevent any power disruptions.
meanings.sent3: As the electrician tried to synchroscope the currents, he accidentally tripped over a cable.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to synchroscope the alternating currents was crucial in maintaining a stable power supply.
meanings.sent5: The technician carefully synchroscoped the currents, ensuring a smooth transition between power sources.
